  ordtri3or(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  3orbi123i(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), cep, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))

blocks.name: ordon
blocks.content: The class of all ordinal numbers is ordinal. Proposition 7.12 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38, but without using the Axiom of Regularity. (Contributed by NM, 17-May-1994.)

blocks.name: onprc
blocks.content: No set contains all ordinal numbers. Proposition 7.13 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38, but without using the Axiom of Regularity. This is also known as the Burali-Forti paradox (remark in [Enderton] p. 194). In 1897, Cesare Burali-Forti noticed that since the "set" of all ordinal numbers is an ordinal class ( ~ ordon ), it must be both an element of the set of all ordinal numbers yet greater than every such element. ZF set theory resolves this paradox by not allowing the class of all ordinal numbers to be a set (so instead it is a proper class). Here we prove the denial of its existence. (Contributed by NM, 18-May-1994.)

blocks.name: ordsson

blocks.name: predon

}

  onint(c0)
  rgen(s1, c0, wss(cint(c0), cv(s1)))
  intss1(cv(s1), c0)
  rspcev(s0, cint(c0), c0, wral(s1, c0, wss(cint(c0), cv(s1))), wral(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  ralbidv(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cint(c0)), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cint(c0), cv(s1)))
  sseq1(cv(s0), cint(c0), cv(s1))
  diff.wral.s(s0, s1, c0, wss(cint(c0), cv(s1)))
  diff.wss.s(s0, cint(c0), cv(s1))
  diff.cint.s(s0, c0)

  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), cint(c0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cint.s(s1, c0)
}

blocks.name: onminesb

  sylbir(wrex(s0, con0, w0), wcel(cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)), crab(s0, con0, w0)), wne(crab(s0, con0, w0), emptycls))
  rabn0(s0, con0, w0)
  mpan(wne(crab(s0, con0, w0), emptycls), wcel(cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)), crab(s0, con0, w0)), wss(crab(s0, con0, w0), con0))
  ssrab2(s0, con0, w0)
  onint(crab(s0, con0, w0))
  simprbi(wcel(cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)), crab(s0, con0, w0)), wsbc(s0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)), w0), wcel(cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)), con0))
  elrabsf(s0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)), con0, w0)
  nfcv(s0, con0)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: oninton
blocks.content: The intersection of a nonempty collection of ordinal numbers is an ordinal number. Compare Exercise 6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 44. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-1997.)

blocks.name: onintrab
blocks.content: The intersection of a class of ordinal numbers exists iff it is an ordinal number. (Contributed by NM, 6-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: onintrab2
blocks.content: An existence condition equivalent to an intersection's being an ordinal number. (Contributed by NM, 6-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: onnmin
blocks.content: No member of a set of ordinal numbers belongs to its minimum. (Contributed by NM, 2-Feb-1997.)

blocks.name: onnminsb
blocks.content: An ordinal number smaller than the minimum of a set of ordinal numbers does not have the property determining that set. ` ps ` is the wff resulting from the substitution of ` A ` for ` x ` in wff ` ph ` . (Contributed by NM, 9-Nov-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm onnminsb(setvar s0, class c0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wi(wcel(c0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0))), wn(w1)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
} = {
  con2d(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0))), w1)
  ex(wcel(c0, con0), w1, wn(wcel(c0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)))))
  sylbir(wa(wcel(c0, con0), w1), wn(wcel(c0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)))), wcel(c0, crab(s0, con0, w0)))
  elrab(s0, c0, con0, w0, w1)
  mpan(wcel(c0, crab(s0, con0, w0)), wn(wcel(c0, cint(crab(s0, con0, w0)))), wss(crab(s0, con0, w0), con0))
  ssrab2(s0, con0, w0)
  onnmin(crab(s0, con0, w0), c0)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

blocks.content: A way to show that an ordinal number equals the minimum of a nonempty collection of ordinal numbers: it must be in the collection, and it must not be larger than any member of the collection. (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: uniordint
blocks.content: The union of a set of ordinals is equal to the intersection of its upper bounds. Problem 2.5(ii) of [BellMachover] p. 471. (Contributed by NM, 20-Sep-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm uniordint(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, con0), wceq(cuni(c0), cint(crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl(wss(c0, con0), wceq(cuni(c0), cint(crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))), wcel(cuni(c0), con0))
  ssonunii(c0)
  syl5reqr(cuni(c0), cint(crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), cint(crab(s0, con0, wss(cuni(c0), cv(s0)))), wcel(cuni(c0), con0))
  inteqi(crab(s0, con0, wss(cuni(c0), cv(s0))), crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  rabbii(s0, con0, wss(cuni(c0), cv(s0)), wral(s1, c0, wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  unissb(s1, c0, cv(s0))
  intmin(s0, cuni(c0), con0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cuni.s(s0, c0)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: sucon

blocks.name: sucex

  sucelon(c0)
  intmin(s0, csuc(c0), con0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, con0)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, c0)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: ordsucelsuc
blocks.content: Membership is inherited by successors. Generalization of Exercise 9 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 42. (Contributed by NM, 22-Jun-1998.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 12-Aug-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm ordsucelsuc(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(word(c0), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))))
} = {
  pm5.21nd(word(c0), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wa(word(c0), word(c1)))
  jca(wa(word(c0), wcel(c1, c0)), word(c0), word(c1))
  simpl(word(c0), wcel(c1, c0))
  ordelord(c0, c1)
  jca(wa(word(c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))), word(c0), word(c1))
  simpl(word(c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)))
  sylanb(word(c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), word(c1), word(csuc(c0)))
  ordsuc(c0)
  sylibr(wa(word(csuc(c0)), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))), word(c1), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordelord(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  pm2.61i(wi(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)))), wcel(c1, universe))
  ex(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))))
  3bitr4d(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1))), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0)))
  adantl(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))))
  ancoms(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))))
  sylanb(word(c1), word(c0), wb(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordsuc(c1)
  ordsseleq(csuc(c1), c0)
  impbid(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1))), wcel(c1, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0))
  ad2antrl(wcel(c1, universe), word(c0), word(c1), wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0)))
  ordsucss(c0, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wi(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wcel(c1, c0)))
  sucssel(c1, universe, c0)
  adantr(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))))
  sylbi(wcel(c1, universe), wb(wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))), wcel(csuc(c1), universe))
  elsucg(csuc(c1), universe, c0)
  a1d(wn(wcel(c1, universe)), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))))
  pm5.21ni(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)))
  elex(c1, c0)
  sylibr(wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(csuc(c1), universe))
  elex(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))
  sucexb(c1)
}

thm ordsucelsuc(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (Ord(c0)‚Üí(c1 ‚àà c0 ‚Üî suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0)))
} = {
  pm5.21nd(Ord(c0), c1 ‚àà c0, suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0), (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)))

  ex(c1 ‚àà ùïå, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (c1 ‚àà c0 ‚Üî suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0)))
  3bitr4d((c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß(Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1))), c1 ‚àà c0, suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0), suc(c1)‚äÜ c0, (suc(c1)‚àà c0 ‚à® suc(c1)= c0))
  adantl(c1 ‚àà ùïå, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (suc(c1)‚äÜ c0 ‚Üî(suc(c1)‚àà c0 ‚à® suc(c1)= c0)))
  ancoms(Ord(c0), Ord(c1), (suc(c1)‚äÜ c0 ‚Üî(suc(c1)‚àà c0 ‚à® suc(c1)= c0)))
  sylanb(Ord(c1), Ord(c0), (suc(c1)‚äÜ c0 ‚Üî(suc(c1)‚àà c0 ‚à® suc(c1)= c0)), Ord(suc(c1)))
  ordsuc(c1)
  ordsseleq(suc(c1), c0)
  impbid((c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß(Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1))), c1 ‚àà c0, suc(c1)‚äÜ c0)
  ad2antrl(c1 ‚àà ùïå, Ord(c0), Ord(c1), (c1 ‚àà c0 ‚Üí suc(c1)‚äÜ c0))
  ordsucss(c0, c1)
  adantr(c1 ‚àà ùïå, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (suc(c1)‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c0))
  sucssel(c1, universe, c0)
  adantr(c1 ‚àà ùïå, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0)‚Üî(suc(c1)‚àà c0 ‚à® suc(c1)= c0)))
  sylbi(c1 ‚àà ùïå, (suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0)‚Üî(suc(c1)‚àà c0 ‚à® suc(c1)= c0)), suc(c1)‚àà ùïå)
  elsucg(suc(c1), universe, c0)
  a1d(¬¨ c1 ‚àà ùïå, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (c1 ‚àà c0 ‚Üî suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0)))
  pm5.21ni(c1 ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà c0, suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0))
  elex(c1, c0)
  sylibr(suc(c1)‚àà suc(c0), c1 ‚àà ùïå, suc(c1)‚àà ùïå)
  elex(suc(c1), suc(c0))
  sucexb(c1)
}

blocks.name: ordsucsssuc
blocks.content: The subclass relationship between two ordinal classes is inherited by their successors. (Contributed by NM, 4-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: ordsucuniel
blocks.content: Given an element ` A ` of the union of an ordinal ` B ` , ` suc A ` is an element of ` B ` itself. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 28-Mar-2012.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ordsucuniel(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(word(c0), wb(wcel(c1, cuni(c0)), wcel(csuc(c1), c0)))
} = {

  syl(word(c0), wi(wcel(c1, cuni(c0)), word(c1)), word(cuni(c0)))

  ex(word(c0), wcel(csuc(c1), c0), word(c1))
  sylibr(wa(word(c0), wcel(csuc(c1), c0)), word(c1), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordelord(c0, csuc(c1))
  ex(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wcel(c1, cuni(c0)), wcel(csuc(c1), c0)))
  con4bid(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wcel(c1, cuni(c0)), wcel(csuc(c1), c0))
  3bitr3d(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wn(wcel(c1, cuni(c0))), wn(wcel(csuc(c1), c0)), wss(cuni(c0), c1), wss(c0, csuc(c1)))
  sylan(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wss(cuni(c0), c1), wss(c0, csuc(c1))), wss(c0, con0))
  ordsson(c0)
  ordunisssuc(c0, c1)
  sylan(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wss(cuni(c0), c1), wn(wcel(c1, cuni(c0)))), word(cuni(c0)))
  orduni(c0)
  ordtri1(cuni(c0), c1)
  sylan2b(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wss(c0, csuc(c1)), wn(wcel(csuc(c1), c0))), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordsuc(c1)
  ordtri1(c0, csuc(c1))
}

blocks.content: The successor of the maximum (i.e. union) of two ordinals is the maximum of their successors. (Contributed by NM, 28-Nov-2003.)

thm ordsucun(class c0, class c1) {

  sylbi(word(cun(c0, c1)), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cun(c0, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), con0)), word(csuc(cun(c0, c1))))
  ordsuc(cun(c0, c1))
  ex(word(csuc(cun(c0, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cun(c0, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), con0))
  ordelon(csuc(cun(c0, c1)), cv(hs0))
  syl2anb(word(c0), word(c1), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), con0)), word(csuc(c0)), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordsuc(c0)
  ordsuc(c1)
  syl(wa(word(csuc(c0)), word(csuc(c1))), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), con0)), word(cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))))
  ordun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  ex(word(cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), con0))
  ordelon(cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1)), cv(hs0))
  expcom(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cun(c0, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))))
  syl6bbr(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wa(word(c0), word(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cun(c0, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c1))))
  3bitr3d(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wa(word(c0), word(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cun(c0, c1))), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c1))), wss(cv(hs0), cun(c0, c1)), wo(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1)))
  adantl(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wss(cv(hs0), cun(c0, c1)), wo(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))))
  ordssun(c0, c1, cv(hs0))
  sylan2(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wss(cv(hs0), cun(c0, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cun(c0, c1)))), word(cun(c0, c1)))
  ordun(c0, c1)
  ordsssuc(cv(hs0), cun(c0, c1))

  adantrr(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), word(c0), word(c1), wb(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0))))

  diff.hs0.c(cun(csuc(c0), csuc(c1)))

  3bitr3d((hs0 ‚àà On ‚àß(Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1))), hs0 ‚àà suc((c0 ‚ãÉ c1)), (hs0 ‚àà suc(c0)‚à® hs0 ‚àà suc(c1)), hs0 ‚äÜ(c0 ‚ãÉ c1), (hs0 ‚äÜ c0 ‚à® hs0 ‚äÜ c1))
  adantl(hs0 ‚àà On, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (hs0 ‚äÜ(c0 ‚ãÉ c1)‚Üî(hs0 ‚äÜ c0 ‚à® hs0 ‚äÜ c1)))
  ordssun(c0, c1, hs0)
  sylan2(hs0 ‚àà On, (Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), (hs0 ‚äÜ(c0 ‚ãÉ c1)‚Üî hs0 ‚àà suc((c0 ‚ãÉ c1))), Ord((c0 ‚ãÉ c1)))
  ordun(c0, c1)

blocks.name: ordunpr
blocks.content: The maximum of two ordinals is equal to one of them. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ordunpr(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, con0)), wcel(cun(c0, c1), cpr(c0, c1)))
} = {

blocks.name: ordunel
blocks.content: The maximum of two ordinals belongs to a third if each of them do. (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: onsucuni
blocks.content: A class of ordinal numbers is a subclass of the successor of its union. Similar to Proposition 7.26 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 41. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2003.)

blocks.name: ordsucuni
blocks.content: An ordinal class is a subclass of the successor of its union. (Contributed by NM, 12-Sep-2003.)

blocks.name: orduniorsuc
blocks.content: An ordinal class is either its union or the successor of its union. If we adopt the view that zero is a limit ordinal, this means every ordinal class is either a limit or a successor. (Contributed by NM, 13-Sep-2003.)

blocks.name: 0elsuc
blocks.content: The successor of an ordinal class contains the empty set. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-1995.)

blocks.name: limon
blocks.content: The class of ordinal numbers is a limit ordinal. (Contributed by NM, 24-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: onssi
blocks.content: An ordinal number is a subset of ` On ` . (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-1994.)

blocks.name: onsuci
blocks.content: The successor of an ordinal number is an ordinal number. Corollary 7N(c) of [Enderton] p. 193. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: onuniorsuci
blocks.content: An ordinal number is either its own union (if zero or a limit ordinal) or the successor of its union. (Contributed by NM, 13-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: onuninsuci
blocks.content: A limit ordinal is not a successor ordinal. (Contributed by NM, 18-Feb-2004.)
